title: Lesson 100
paragraph: This lesson focuses on thought and existence, emphasizing sentience, cognition, and philosophical reflection.

words.meaning: able to perceive or feel things; conscious
words.japaneseMeaning: 感覚を持つ、知覚できる
words.example: Humans are sentient beings capable of reflection.

words.meaning: relating to the process of thinking or knowing
words.example: Cognitive skills improve with practice and learning.
She was reflective about her past decisions.

words.meaning: aware of and able to think and respond
words.japaneseMeaning: 意識している、自覚している
words.example: He was conscious of his surroundings.

words.meaning: relating to the study of fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence
words.example: She maintained a philosophical attitude towards challenges.

words.meaning: based on reason or logic; sensible
words.example: He made a rational decision after considering all facts.

words.meaning: relating to the ability to think and understand ideas and information
words.example: She engages in intellectual discussions about philosophy.

words.japaneseMeaning: 鋭い洞察力を持つ、知覚力のある
words.example: He is perceptive in noticing subtle changes in behavior.

words.meaning: engaged in conjecture rather than knowledge; theoretical
words.example: The article offered speculative ideas about future technology.
